What would I do without you?

"Can you build a chatbot for our website"
"Can you help us with our chatbot"
We need a company to help us with our chatbot.

examples.text: I am so lonely I could cry

intents.description: guest expressed some kind of sadness emotion
A bit off topic, however we can discuss it anyway

examples.text: Can you build a website for my company

intents.description: Guest wants someone to design a website for thier business

examples.text: What kind of applications can be built with python

values.text: I didn't understand. You can try rephrasing.
Can you reword your statement? I'm not understanding.
I didn't get your meaning.

If you are just starting out, ask me about
    1) python beginners tutorial
    2) python course
    3) Watson Assistant

Ask me again with "more python hints".

Here are some other topics
    1) python community
    2) awesome python lists
    3) Watson Discovery

More, more, more ... !
    1) python IDE
    2) python cheat sheets
    3) Watson Studio

Seriously ....
    1) python keywords
    2) python assignment
    3) machine learning

Furthermore.
   1) python iterators
   2) python flow control
   3) python operators

Yes, I understand, you really need to know more ...
    1) Object oriented python
    2) Functional Python
    3) Paradigm
    4) python advanced topics
I could go on and on about Python and IBM products and services.  Please, tell me what you want to talk about.

Vivid Ventures is not currently focusing on website design. There are several designers here in the South Sound you might contact from our list. We do however help designers and developers integrate IBM services into their applications. If you need an assistant like me for your business we would like to help you with the training.
You're very welcome!
Only my best effort for you!
I am glad you are satisfied.
My pleasure.
Anytime.
Happy to help.
For you the world.
Glad to be of service.
You betcha!
Here are a some links to get you started: 1) Python for beginners 2) Python examples 3) w3schools examples If you need "more python hints" just let me know.
Great! Looking now ...

I really enjoy discussing Python, however here are some other topics we may have in common:  * Watson - Assistant, Discovery  * security - AppID or Verify  * IOT - MQTT, LoRA, NodeRED  * data science - analytics, machine learning  * API's - OpenAPI, Loopback, API Connect  * LinuxONE. If you have questions you can always Contact Us.

Contact Us with your questions about  * Watson - Assistant, Discovery  * security - AppID or Verify  * IOT - MQTT, LoRA, NodeRED  * data science - analytics, machine learning  * API's - OpenAPI, Loopback, API Connect  * LinuxONE.
The special of the day is Watson Assistant. Contact Us for a demonstration. I suggest you give it a try!
Contact Us to help you understand the structure of business documents with Watson Discovery.
Ben and his co-organizers would be glad to have you attend.  I will look up some upcoming events.  Hang on a sec ....

Artificial intelligence is the application of machine learning to build systems that simulate human thought processes. It includes several disciplines such as machine learning, knowledge discovery, natural language processing, vision, and human-computer interaction. 1 * check out the IBM developer AI courses * or read a book by Jerome Nilmeier, PhD "Data Science and Engineering at Enterprise Scale" * and view Harvard CS50 course "Introduction to Artificial Intelligence with Python 2020" on YouTube
Here are some of my favorites: Pyvideo Raymond Hettinger Talks Corey Schaffer videos Socratica beginners playlist CS50 - Harvard Freecodecamp beginner tutorial
I am so sorry, it has been a long shift, I do not understand your intent exactly. Give me a little slack, try giving me the keywords only.

Here is a short list of companies and organizations using Python. Industrial Light and Magic, Google, Facebook, Instagram, Spotify, Quora, Netflix, Dropbox, Reddit, Uber1   IBM, Linux Weekly News, Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) Theoretical Physics Division, Nokia, National Weather Service, NASA, Red Hat, Thawte Consulting, University of California-Irvine 2

The types of apps that can be built in Python are:

Blockchain, Command-line, Audio and Video, System Administration, Machine Learning, Business Applications, Game App Development, Web and Software Development, Image Processing and OCR, Automated Testing, Web Crawlers.

Maybe this will help ...

https://tacomajs.org/mw/mediawiki-1.32.0/Pierce_County_Employers

https://weather.com/

Python is an open source interpreted, high-level, general-purpose server side computer programming language 1 allowing the creation of web apps, data science experiments, natural language and image processing, as well as DevOps system scripting. It has simple syntax, a rich ecosystem of modules, a capability to interact with other languages and platforms, and strong community support across multiple industries. Would you like me to find some beginner tutorial links for you?
It sounds like you're not very interested in Python.  Are you interested in another topic?
Would you consider taking a course to learn more about Python?
Hi. Thanks for being here. What Python questions do you have?
S'up.
Ha!...If this is a test. It is working. I am here for you.

Take a look at the free course:
 https://cognitiveclass.ai/courses/python-for-data-science

If you want to know about "more courses" just say so :-)

Sign up for the paid version or audit for free at:
https://www.coursera.org/learn/python-for-applied-data-science-ai

Or you could give this course a try:
https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/scientific-computing-with-python/python-for-everybody/

Study data science and python on:
https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/data-analysis-with-python/data-analysis-with-python-course/
You sound educated and perceptive.
If I am responding too quickly  I c o u l d  t r y  p u t t i n g  s p a c e s  b e t w e e n  m y  l e t t e r s.

Let's not talk about my personal life,
I only want to talk about Python.
I bet you say that in all your chats!
If you ask this enough times I am sure to repeat myself.

I love it when people ask me that!
Ask me again ...
It was nice chatting with you, come back soon!
Thanks for visiting, if we can be of assistance in the future let us know.
Y'all come back now ya hear?
See ya' round.
A hui hou.
Until we meet again.
See ya' later.
I am sorry to hear your feeling that way. My experience and training has been mostly technical and my emotional IQ is kinda low.  I hope you can find someone to speak with about your situation.

IBM Consulting Services supports an open and secure path to multi-cloud transformation with experts that have the talent, tools and experience to help you navigate your cloud journey. Connect with with services for Amazon, Google, or Microsoft.

Semantic iterators in Python are a fundamental part of the language and in many cases go unseen as they are implicitly used in the for (foreach) statement, in list comprehensions, and in generator expressions. All of Python's standard built-in collection types support iteration, as well as many classes that are part of the standard library.wiki for value in sequence:     print(value) You might also be looking for iterator patterns.

Manage your various API's with
https://developer.ibm.com/apiconnect/
Simple examples include arithmetic (e.g. addition with +), comparison (e.g. "greater than" with >), and logical operations (e.g. AND).
Assignment statements are used to (re)bind names to values and to modify attributes or items of mutable objects. docs the_answer = 42

Python is an open source interpreted, high-level, general-purpose server side computer programming language 1 allowing the creation of web apps, data science experiments, natural language and image processing, as well as DevOps system scripting. It has simple syntax, a rich ecosystem of modules, a capability to interact with other languages and platforms, and strong community support across multiple industries.

Hello my name is Michelle. 
Welcome to the Vivid Ventures website.

I'm here to answer your questions specifically about Python, and throw in a few comments here and there about IBM products and services.

If you don't have an idea of what to ask, try "python hints".

Sometimes a fresh start is the best way.  My training is limited to Python, so I am refraining from straying off topic. I am most able to answer questions about Python or IBM products or services.  To get some ideas ask for "python hints".
It has been a long shift, I am doing my best to meet your needs, however I may need more training.  Hopefully you can understand how hard it is to know everything for everybody.
Repeatedly asking me to restart stretches my ability to quickly think up new greetings. It also makes me think you might be trying to test to see if myself will start repeating myself.  He! He!
